commit_message:
Introduce a function to verify for fixed crm_diff

We currently use crm_simulate to understand if a resource needs
an update in the CIB. This is less than ideal, but we had to do
so due to rhbz#1561617. Now that this BZ is fixed we will be
able to use crm_diff to compare CIBs. In order to stay backwards
compatible we need to understand if we have a fixed crm_diff or not.
So we can use the crm_diff method only when a fixed crm_diff binary
is present.

Tested this on an older, broken crm_diff:
[root@overcloud-controller-0 cibs]# crm_diff --cib --original-string='..xml1..' --new-string='..xml2..'
<diff format="2" digest="d86aa7f248182e125820c743bcb6118d">
  <version>
    <source admin_epoch="0" epoch="86" num_updates="125"/>
    <target admin_epoch="0" epoch="86" num_updates="125"/>
  </version>
  <change operation="modify" path="/cib/configuration/resources/bundle[@id='galera-bundle']/storage/storage-mapping[@id='mysql-foo']">
    <change-list>
      <change-attr name="id" operation="set" value="mysql-foo"/>
      <change-attr name="target-dir" operation="set" value="/foo"/>
    </change-list>
    <change-result>
      <storage-mapping id="mysql-foo" options="rw" source-dir="/foo" target-dir="/foo"/>
    </change-result>
  </change>
  <change operation="modify" path="/cib/configuration/resources/bundle[@id='galera-bundle']/storage/storage-mapping[@id='mysql-bar']">
    <change-list>
      <change-attr name="id" operation="set" value="mysql-bar"/>
      <change-attr name="target-dir" operation="set" value="/bar"/>
    </change-list>
    <change-result>
      <storage-mapping id="mysql-bar" options="rw" source-dir="/bar" target-dir="/bar"/>
    </change-result>
  </change>
</diff>
[root@overcloud-controller-0 cibs]# echo $?
1

On a fixed crm_diff:
[root@overcloud-controller-0 cibs]# crm_diff --cib --original-string='..xml1..' --new-string='..xml2..'
[root@overcloud-controller-0 cibs]# echo $?
0

Change-Id: I888b9ae54b8e639a2dbffb1744aa27edae4a4a57

commit_message:
Resource_provider API handler does not return specific error codes

There are a few places in the resource_provider.py placement
API handler module that need to be updated to return custom
error codes.

Closes-Bug: #1778929

subject: [Fullstack] HA L3 agent restart only standby agents
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-10 14:54:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "[Fullstack] HA L3 agent restart only standby agents

In fullstack test which is testing if there is no packet lost
during restart of agents there were restarted always all agents
which hosted router.
In case when as first was restarted 'master' agent it might
lead to the case when after restart 'master' node was switched
to second L3 agent and that caused lost of few packets and
failed test.
This test should only check if restart of standby agents will
not cause any packet lost so this patch do it in this way.

commit_message:
[Fullstack] HA L3 agent restart only standby agents

In fullstack test which is testing if there is no packet lost
during restart of agents there were restarted always all agents
which hosted router.
In case when as first was restarted 'master' agent it might
lead to the case when after restart 'master' node was switched
to second L3 agent and that caused lost of few packets and
failed test.
This test should only check if restart of standby agents will
not cause any packet lost so this patch do it in this way.

Change-Id: I6293169d7d7f35e3a9726071e63003ac569dd01e
Closes-Bug: #1776459
(cherry picked from commit c57a5d9d8aef4a9b89e3d41c293ceb40d7ebad22)

commit_message:
Backport tox.ini to switch to stestr

The pike branch was still using ostestr (instead of stestr) which makes
running tests significantly different from queens or master. To make
things behave the same way this commit backports most of the tox.ini
from queens so that pike will behave the same way for running tests.
This does not use the standard backport mechanism because it involves a
lot of different commits over time. It's also not a functional change
for nova itself, so the proper procedure is less important here.

Change-Id: Ie207afaf8defabc1d1eb9332f43a9753a00f784d

commit_message:
Support node's deploy_step field

Adds support for a node's ``deploy_step`` (read-only) field.
The deploy step indicates which step is being performed
during the deployment/provisioning of a node.
It is available starting with Bare Metal API version 1.44.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/579968/
Change-Id: I93ac628bca0822a9a359926389543f7db7fb3e56
Story: #1753128
Task: #22925

commit_message:
Switch to using stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is maintained project
to which all Openstack projects should migrate.

Let's switch it then.

Also adjust requirements to pass the gate.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I79b2220c20a04e2e33360bc330b5b4b4124caf71
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove testrepository and .testr.conf

This commit is a follow-up of "switch to using stestr"
which was merged already [1].
After switch to using stestr, testrepository and .testr.conf
are unnecessary and should be removed.

This patch also switch from "test" to "stestr" for coverage job .

[1] https://review.openstack.org/571716

Change-Id: I6b506a19edf06a5bc40472f84a51eaae98583a62

commit_message:
hardware: fix hugepages memory usage per intances

In the algo to compute memory, when several instances are their memory
backed on a same host NUMA node, we always compute the memory used
based on the initial 'used' value of hostcell.

Partial-Bug: #1594529
Change-Id: I5b8684b10688b91ca36a509ea0cb8bee397263d6
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit b1c45fedc3b80769f21ffe5ff748593a4b017a7a)

commit_message:
Add utility function for datastore clusters

Add new function which returns reference and name of the specified
datastore cluster. The cluster can be specified either by name or by its
moid.

Change-Id: I73df95294accc1954da571437efc8302edf544d2

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ib8493a9a2ec30cafa70a67a6f5fd1fee29432ad7

commit_message:
Add support for cells v2,

This change adds relations necessary for registering a compute cell
with the superconductor. For a cell to be registered this charm
must have relations with the compute cells conductor, database and
message queue. Only when all these relations are complete can the
registration happen. Below are major changes included in this PR.

* Add nova-cell-api relation for communicating with the
  nova-cell-conductor
* Add shared-db-cell relation for communicating with the
  a compute cells database.
* Add amqp-cell relation for communicating with the
  a compute cells message queue.
* Add methods for registering ceells with the
  superconductors database.
* Charm helper sync

Change-Id: I54f98c1d420b6a6b1dd8ed7dbd00a2362b584b81

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ic7138594becaf7061d8b4d0d3fe9bf243fef35af
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-13 18:59:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'update pylint to 1.9.2

The older version of pylint being used does not work correctly under
python 3. In order to be able to update the pylint job to run under
python 3, we need to update the tool.

This patch updates to the latest version at this time. It also updates
and pins astroid, which was previously capped. Using a pin instead of
a cap should let us avoid issues with new releases while being
specific about which version to actually use.

Change-Id: I6443247ab110dc9d5e71d23dc40ceabb439e23be
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-07-09 08:00:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'update pylint to 1.9.2

commit_message:
update pylint to 1.9.2

The older version of pylint being used does not work correctly under
python 3. In order to be able to update the pylint job to run under
python 3, we need to update the tool.

This patch updates to the latest version at this time. It also updates
and pins astroid, which was previously capped. Using a pin instead of
a cap should let us avoid issues with new releases while being
specific about which version to actually use.

This patch also fix lower-constraints.

Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Hai <nguyentrihai93@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I6443247ab110dc9d5e71d23dc40ceabb439e23be
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Adding Ansible roles for TripleO

Based on the newly introduced design of per-repository Ansible
roles for TripleO component management, this change adds the
bulk of repos needed for TripleO Ansible tooling.

commit_message:
Add OpenStack operations Ansible role

This Ansible role handles tasks related to operating an OpenStack cloud
deployed with TripleO. It contains tasks for cleaning up Docker, restarting
services, and fetching log files.

Change-Id: Id92ad1a43f3e2c5947a49f17e7c1cf9e3f3fefc4
Needed-By: I40ec0766e4918d5def9cda508741e6d0c17d7b2d

commit_message:
Revert "Adds docker SFC and cleans up ODL envs"

This reverts commit baec8bba6fc347052e737524683d14db5dafd26b.
We need to double-check it does not break compatibility by removing
containerized services leaving only its BM alternatives.
Specifically, openstack/tripleo-heat-templates /
environments/neutron-sfc-opendaylight.yaml cannot be just removed
w/o deprecation.

Change-Id: Id88b3141284311ce56cdd45a58d257e92bd6e621

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-05 20:21:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'update the pti to use tox for building docs and releasenotes

As part of planning out the python3 transition we realized that in
order to have a self-testing patch in each repository to switch the
documentation and release notes builds to use python3, we would need
to include some information in the repository that the job would read
to decide which version of python to use. After considering several
options, we realized that this requirement meant we had set the API
for the documentation and release notes jobs at the wrong "level" of
the stack.

This patch restores the use of tox for building documentation and
release notes in the standard project testing interface. Rather than
using the "venv" environment, it specifies new environments for "docs"
and "releasenotes" based on the common pattern we have in most
projects to provide those as a convenience for developers.

The Python-specific notes about adding those environments as a
convenience are removed, since those environments are now required.

Change-Id: Ibdee118f30972e9dc67952b921f493e9c1a116ff
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
update the pti to use tox for building docs

As part of planning out the python3 transition we realized that in
order to have a self-testing patch in each repository to switch the
documentation build to use python3, we would need to include some
information in the repository that the job would read to decide which
version of python to use. After considering several options, we
realized that this requirement meant we had set the API for the
documentation jobs at the wrong "level" of the stack.

This patch restores the use of tox for building documentation in the
standard project testing interface. Rather than using the "venv"
environment, it specifies a new environment for "docs", based on the
common pattern we have in most projects to provide that as a
convenience for developers.

The Python-specific notes about adding the environment as a
convenience are removed, since it is now required.

Change-Id: Ibdee118f30972e9dc67952b921f493e9c1a116ff
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add OS_AUTH_TYPE env var in openrc file

For gnocchi cli this env var is mandatory in the openrc.

Default value: password

Closes-Bug: 1781552
Change-Id: I1e54d53dd131351dda70d3d166ae8e2029caa1cb
(cherry picked from commit 93dc5f50dff78267d8b39a396d93260804d554af)

commit_message:
add check_review_status.py

I have been using this script to apply the house rules to governance
changes to help track when they are ready to be approved. I thought it
would be good to share it for others to be able to see and review the
work.

Change-Id: I41e3338858f546705e78ce5428a09dfe3b904947
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
use tempest_format to pkg for non containerized undercloud

* Since tempest container is shipped with containerized undercloud
  and above jobs does not have containerized UC and if tempest_format
  is switched to container, it will pull tempest docker images
  from dockerhub which does contains latest packages which leads
  to testing older commits and which in return we are able to late
  find out the issues caused by tempest and python-tempestconf.

Change-Id: Ie38c7be6f6fe49fe976866c2d8b474d7910171d7

commit_message:
Add OS_AUTH_TYPE env var in openrc file

For gnocchi cli this env var is mandatory in the openrc.

Default value: password

Closes-Bug: 1781552
Change-Id: I1e54d53dd131351dda70d3d166ae8e2029caa1cb
(cherry picked from commit 93dc5f50dff78267d8b39a396d93260804d554af)

commit_message:
Disable keepalived ping tests by default

At the moment, the keepalived ping tests are something that is
configured by default which is ideal because it's hardcoded with
a public IP address that might result in a failing deployment
if the environment does not for some reason reach it.

We should leave the option to be there however not have all default
deployments hitting this IP as it can introduce behaviour where
if that IP fails, every single OpenStack Ansible deployment would
fail afterwards.

Closes-Bug: #1672453
Change-Id: I5aec4664e67fb2b3e1c0a2fc9782a4ccaa78a39a

commit_message:
Run Docker container without the controller service

This adds the option to run the Docker container without the controller
service running on the container.
This is useful in order to create separation between the Dragonflow
API (df-db) and the controller service.

Related-Bug: #1778007

Change-Id: I4fb77ae03e47942a75d34bfb4f8c80db21a3aec6

commit_message:
Fix KeyError if a deprecated key is given

It happens when a deprecated key is given(i.e. os-auth-ver). The service shall
change the reference before calling oslo.config.

Change-Id: I841f027f90e353b7ea5e1ec059286e8fa9b94f49
Closes-Bug: #1774722
(cherry picked from commit c1499e54cdb06dab5e54686035bf56a537208d61)

commit_message:
Adds docker SFC and cleans up ODL envs

There are now duplicate places where environment files for deployments
are kept.  Those include environments/ and environments/services.  The
files in environments/ are incorrect and should be removed to leave only
a single place (environments/services) to store docker services.
environments/services-baremetal house the legacy bm services.

This patch also adds a missing docker service for SFC so that we can
also include an ODL SFC docker env file.

Change-Id: If70818db9577b7d80c4acd0d0577d9432b5c8bef
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-03 09:41:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because of that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I574364f9b072387883bedfc7404072642041f380
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-07-16 07:47:47.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because of that

Change-Id: I574364f9b072387883bedfc7404072642041f380
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because of that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I574364f9b072387883bedfc7404072642041f380

commit_message:
Dockerfile: Create neutron configurations

If the Neutron configuration files does not exist in the
docker image, use Dragonflow's configuration files as neutron's
configuration files.

Related-Bug: #1778007

Change-Id: I167a290358427bd94dba9c6db6f02a153b5ca734

commit_message:
Add conductor_group field to nodes and conductors tables

Adds the field to both tables as a VARCHAR(255), non-nullable, with a
default of "".

Change-Id: Iba812dd959094d73034c20345d005f8613a17b1b
Story: 2001795
Task: 22639

commit_message:
Enable loadbalancer for kubernetes masters

This uses our existing HAProxy and vip management to route requests
to the kubernetes API services on each master.

See also other HA/LB options explained:

https://github.com/kubernetes-incubator/kubespray/pull/2126

Co-authored-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

Change-Id: If53e9c194f540fe67a893217d76bf3e35523b5d7

commit_message:
Remove unused TimingSession class

TimingSession is removed and replaced by keystone session (see [1]).
This patch remove it from monasca client.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/579139/

Change-Id: I4bfcef96bcb9c8fd14e2c57f318630aa508710ca
Story: #2002978
Task: #22987

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-26 10:23:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "network: Add 'populate_networks' to network API

This provides a generic way to fully populate the RequestedNetwork
objects created at boot time. This mostly reuses and replaces the code
from the existing 'create_pci_requests_for_sriov_ports' with the
following functional changes:

- physnet information is always retrieved if available, rather than just
  for SR-IOV ports, and is used to populate the 'physnet' attribute.
- The network ID is now retrieved if only a port ID is provided and is
  used to populate the 'network_id' attribute.

We don't add tests for the new function because we'll get them for free
in an upcoming patch that removes 'create_pci_requests_for_sriov_ports'.

Part of blueprint numa-aware-vswitches

Change-Id: I3dde6074d69e299f2844675ef968c8f949722395
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-05-07 15:44:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "network: Add 'populate_networks' to network API

  for SR-IOV ports, and is used to populate the 'physnet' attribute.
- The network ID is now retrieved if only a port ID is provided and is

We don't add tests for the new function because we'll get them for free

Part of blueprint numa-aware-vswitches

Change-Id: I3dde6074d69e299f2844675ef968c8f949722395
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2018-05-10 13:43:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "network: Add 'populate_networks' to network API

This provides a generic way to fully populate the RequestedNetwork
objects created at boot time. This mostly reuses and replaces the code
from the existing 'create_pci_requests_for_sriov_ports' with the
following functional changes:

- physnet information is almost always retrieved if available, rather
  than just for SR-IOV ports, and is used to populate the 'physnet'
  attribute. The only exception to this is auto-allocated networks.
- The network ID is now retrieved if only a port ID is provided and is
  used to populate the 'network_id' attribute.

We don't add tests for the new function because we'll get them for free
in an upcoming patch that removes 'create_pci_requests_for_sriov_ports'.

Part of blueprint numa-aware-vswitches

Change-Id: I3dde6074d69e299f2844675ef968c8f949722395
", 'number': 3}, {'created': '2018-06-08 13:30:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "network: Add 'create_resource_requests' to network API

This provides a generic way to get all resources required due to the
requested networks. This mostly reuses and replaces the code from the
existing 'create_pci_requests_for_sriov_ports' with the following
functional changes:

- Both functions now return an instance of 'InstanceNUMANetworkInfo',
  which is populated with additional metadata about the requested
  networks
- physnet information is almost always retrieved if available, rather
  than just for SR-IOV ports, and is used to populate the 'physnet'
  attribute of the returned 'InstanceNUMANetworkInfo' instance. The only
  exception to this is auto-allocated networks.
- The network ID is now retrieved if only a port ID is provided and is
  used to populate the 'network_id' attribute.

The 'tunnel' attribute of the 'InstanceNUMANetworkInfo' object is not
currently set in this function and will be addressed separately. This is
not an issue as the value returned from this function is not yet used.

Part of blueprint numa-aware-vswitches

Change-Id: I3dde6074d69e299f2844675ef968c8f949722395

", 'number': 6}, {'created': '2018-06-14 16:23:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "network: Add 'create_resource_requests' to network API

This provides a generic way to get all resources required due to the
requested networks. This mostly reuses and replaces the code from the
existing 'create_pci_requests_for_sriov_ports' with the following
functional changes:

- Both functions now return an instance of a new object,
  'InstanceNUMANetworkInfo', which is populated with additional metadata
  about the requested networks
- physnet information is almost always retrieved if available, rather
  than just for SR-IOV ports, and is used to populate the 'physnet'
  attribute of the returned 'InstanceNUMANetworkInfo' instance. The only
  exception to this is auto-allocated networks.
- The network ID is now retrieved if only a port ID is provided and is
  used to populate the 'network_id' attribute.

The 'tunnel' attribute of the 'InstanceNUMANetworkInfo' object is not
currently set in this function and will be addressed separately. This is

Change-Id: I3dde6074d69e299f2844675ef968c8f949722395
", 'number': 7}, {'created': '2018-06-21 16:38:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "network: Always retrieve network information if available

We're going to need to consume information about the physnet and tunnel
status of networks. While we don't currently retrieve the latter, we do
retrieve the former but only for SR-IOV ports. Modify this so physnet
information is retrieve for any non-auto and non-null network requests.
This is stored in a new object, 'InstanceNUMANetworkInfo', which defines
fields for both physnets and tunneled networks. The latter attribute of
this object is naturally unset for now, but this is not an issue as the
value returned from this function is not yet used.

commit_message:
network: Always retrieve network information if available

We're going to need to consume information about the physnet and tunnel
status of networks. While we don't currently retrieve the latter, we do
retrieve the former but only for SR-IOV ports. Modify this so physnet
information is retrieved for any non-auto and non-null network requests.
This is stored in a new object, 'NetworkMetadata', which defines fields
for both physnets and tunneled networks. The latter attribute of this
object is unset for now, but this is not an issue as the value returned
from this function is not yet used.

Part of blueprint numa-aware-vswitches

Change-Id: I3dde6074d69e299f2844675ef968c8f949722395

commit_message:
Add multi-virtual undercloud guide

This commit adds the Multiple virtual undercloud guide inside the
tripleo-docs project. As discussed inside recent TripleO meetings,
instead of having this inside the tripleo-quickstart-utils projects, it
has more sense for it to be here.
It was modified and fixed to reflect the needs of the audience that
might be interested on the project from a general TripleO perspective.

Change-Id: Id348511594d1fe340c94eb3afc399788a677e9ea

commit_message:
Install openvswitch packages on 'ml2.ovs.dvr' configuration

The 'neutron_package_list' is extended when 'neutron_needs_openvswitch'
is true. Which needs neutron_services['neutron-openvswitch-agent'].service_en
to be true. Which it is only for 'ml2.ovs' and not 'ml2.ovs.dvr'.

Change-Id: I6a4f597377e711508f26b142d7184cfd08b3ffaa
(cherry picked from commit 38884cb091f1908650daaf4e35681a5c2f51adbd)

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I55060b1d99b9a00b20c98fbb429d072568265695

commit_message:
Unify the Manila HA and non-HA docker configurations

Relocate the list of docker volumes and environment used by the
ManilaShare service so that a common list can be used in both HA and
non-HA deployments. For HA, the list is passed to puppet-tripleo via
hiera data.

Closes-Bug: #1749752
Depends-On: Ia81602f8a3454fcb0be2eaa9126021331d37b147
Change-Id: I66a76d3226d5a1d3e0b5387326305d1f3313a340

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-03 10:58:45.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/objects/node.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/objects/test_port.py', 'ironic/objects/conversions.py', 'ironic/objects/port.py', 'ironic/objects/base.py'], 'message': '[PoC]: General object version conversion framework

Do not merge!

This change is a proof of concept for a general framework for converting
objects between different versions during rolling upgrades. It aims to
provide classes for common object changes, while not restricting the
complexity of such changes. Also provided is an implementation of the
_convert_to_version method in the IronicObject base class that uses the
conversions framework.

The provided NewField conversion class supports the common case of the
addition of a new field to an object. This class is demonstrated through
its use in reimplementing the conversion for the Port.physical_network
field.

Also provided is a conversion class for the configdrive rolling upgrade
test case used in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/455811. This has not
been tested.

Change-Id: I8def16f1c909580575e19371e37a206c4cf38058
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
[PoC]: General object version conversion framework

Do not merge!

This change is a proof of concept for a general framework for converting
objects between different versions during rolling upgrades. It aims to
provide classes for common object changes, while not restricting the
complexity of such changes. Also provided is an implementation of the
_convert_to_version method in the IronicObject base class that uses the
conversions framework.

The provided NewField conversion class supports the common case of the
addition of a new field to an object. This class is demonstrated through
its use in reimplementing the conversion for the Port.physical_network
field.

Also provided is a conversion class for the configdrive rolling upgrade
test case used in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/455811. This has not
been tested.

Change-Id: I8def16f1c909580575e19371e37a206c4cf38058

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-08 17:54:25.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I2ee74a543edbfbec4e73ace261b1309988347756
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I2ee74a543edbfbec4e73ace261b1309988347756

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-11 09:09:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP Enforce proper ordering when applying firewall rules

The tripleo firewall module has fundamentally three pieces:
1) firewall::pre (allows existing connections/ssh/icmp)
2) firewall::rule (allows services traffic)
3) firewall::post (drops all traffic)

One of the assumptions coded in the module is the following line:
Service<||> -> Class['tripleo::firewall::post']

Which has been added so that (see also bug LP#1643575):
"""
use ordering to make sure we start all Services in catalog before post
rules. It ensure that we don't drop all traffic before starting the
services, which could lead to services errors (e.g. trying to reach database or amqp)
"""

The problem is that there is nothing specifying that the firewall rules
created by tripleo services need to be implemented between the pre and
post classes. So the following can happen:
Jul 10 05:04:13 overcloud-controller-1 systemd: Started OpenSSH server daemon.
Jul 10 05:04:13 overcloud-controller-1 puppet-user[32418]: (/Stage[main]/Ssh::Server::Service/Service[sshd]) Triggered 'refresh' from 2 events
Jul 10 05:04:13 overcloud-controller-1 puppet-user[32418]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall::Pre/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[000 accept related established rules]/Firewall[000 accept related established rules ipv4]/ensure) created
...
Jul 10 05:04:13 overcloud-controller-1 puppet-user[32418]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall::Post/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[998 log all]/Firewall[998 log all ipv4]/ensure) created
...

This means that we can actually open the traffic for our services *after*
said traffic has been completely blocked. In order to fix this we
tag the pre/post rules with a different tag and add resource collectors
to actually enforce proper ordering. We now get:
...
Jul 11 08:54:43 overcloud-controller-0 puppet-user[32554]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall::Pre/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[000 accept related established rules]/Firewall[000 accept related established rules ipv4]/ensure) created
...
Jul 11 08:54:43 overcloud-controller-0 puppet-user[32554]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall/Tripleo::Firewall::Service_rules[cinder_api]/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[119 cinder]/Firewall[119 cinder ipv4]/ensure) created
...
Jul 11 08:54:52 overcloud-controller-0 puppet-user[32554]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall::Post/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[998 log all]/Firewall[998 log all ipv4]/ensure) created

WIP because I want to run a bunch of additional tests

Change-Id: I01e681a6305e2708bf364781a2032265b146d065
Closes-Bug: #1781147

Tested this by doing 20 deploys of 1ctrl+1cmp and then scaling up the
overcloud to 3ctrl+2cmp.

The reason this change, besides being semantically correct, is needed
for scaling up the controller role is the following:
1) When we detect a scaleup situation, we call 'pcs cluster node add <newnode>'
   from the bootstrap node

2) It can happen that 1) succeeds because the node still had no iptables
   at all, so pcs communication succeeds. So at this point the cluster
   has added a new node and all is well

3) Now we apply the pre and post rules and all traffic is blocked. And
   slowly we start adding rules to let services be accessible over the
   network.

4) pacemaker is unable to talk to other nodes and assumes a network split.
   Eventually it will start fencing node to guarantee the state of the
   remote nodes and so the deploy will fail.

With this change if the 'pcs cluster node add' call succeeds we are
guaranteed to not interrupt network traffic afterwards.

Change-Id: I01e681a6305e2708bf364781a2032265b146d065
Closes-Bug: #1781147

commit_message:
Enforce proper ordering when applying firewall rules

The tripleo firewall module has fundamentally three pieces:
1) firewall::pre (allows existing connections/ssh/icmp)
2) firewall::rule (allows services traffic)
3) firewall::post (drops all traffic)

One of the assumptions coded in the module is the following line:
Service<||> -> Class['tripleo::firewall::post']

Which has been added so that (see also bug LP#1643575):
"""
use ordering to make sure we start all Services in catalog before post
rules. It ensure that we don't drop all traffic before starting the
services, which could lead to services errors (e.g. trying to reach database or amqp)
"""

The problem is that there is nothing specifying that the firewall rules
created by tripleo services need to be implemented between the pre and
post classes. So the following can happen:
Jul 10 05:04:13 overcloud-controller-1 systemd: Started OpenSSH server daemon.
Jul 10 05:04:13 overcloud-controller-1 puppet-user[32418]: (/Stage[main]/Ssh::Server::Service/Service[sshd]) Triggered 'refresh' from 2 events
Jul 10 05:04:13 overcloud-controller-1 puppet-user[32418]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall::Pre/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[000 accept related established rules]/Firewall[000 accept related established rules ipv4]/ensure) created
...
Jul 10 05:04:13 overcloud-controller-1 puppet-user[32418]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall::Post/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[998 log all]/Firewall[998 log all ipv4]/ensure) created
...
Jul 10 05:04:14 overcloud-controller-1 puppet-user[32418]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall/Tripleo::Firewall::Service_rules[cinder_api]/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[119 cinder]/Firewall[119 cinder ipv4]/ensure) created

This means that we can actually open the traffic for our services *after*
said traffic has been completely blocked. In order to fix this we
tag the pre/post rules with a different tag and add resource collectors
to actually enforce proper ordering. We now get:
...
Jul 11 08:54:43 overcloud-controller-0 puppet-user[32554]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall::Pre/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[000 accept related established rules]/Firewall[000 accept related established rules ipv4]/ensure) created
...
Jul 11 08:54:43 overcloud-controller-0 puppet-user[32554]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall/Tripleo::Firewall::Service_rules[cinder_api]/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[119 cinder]/Firewall[119 cinder ipv4]/ensure) created
...
Jul 11 08:54:52 overcloud-controller-0 puppet-user[32554]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall::Post/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[998 log all]/Firewall[998 log all ipv4]/ensure) created

Tested this by doing 20 deploys of 1ctrl+1cmp and then scaling up the
overcloud to 3ctrl+2cmp.

The reason this change, besides being semantically correct, is needed
for scaling up the controller role is the following:
1) When we detect a scaleup situation, we call 'pcs cluster node add <newnode>'
   from the bootstrap node

2) It can happen that 1) succeeds because the node still had no iptables
   at all, so pcs communication succeeds. So at this point the cluster
   has added a new node and all is well

3) Now we apply the pre and post rules and all traffic is blocked. And
   slowly we start adding rules to let services be accessible over the
   network.

4) pacemaker is unable to talk to other nodes and assumes a network split.
   Eventually it will start fencing node to guarantee the state of the
   remote nodes and so the deploy will fail.

With this change if the 'pcs cluster node add' call succeeds we are
guaranteed to not interrupt network traffic afterwards.

Change-Id: I01e681a6305e2708bf364781a2032265b146d065
Closes-Bug: #1781147

commit_message:
Increase the step for gnocchi_db_sync

swift-proxy and gnocchi both run on step_4. However, swift_proxy should
be ready before gnocchi. This patch moves gnocchi_db_sync to step_5 to
be sure that swift-proxy is started before gnocchi. gnocchi_db_sync has
higher start_order to start before other gnocchi services.

(cherry picked from commit 67489e63f07ea73d934e51666f19229a629a6c77)
Change-Id: I0044c78c4a6d751fc9d0cf6b54ed634032933934
Closes-Bug: 1781162

commit_message:
Set trusted port only once in iptables firewall driver

Patch [1] added configuration of forward rule for trusted ports in
iptables firewall driver.

This patch fixes issue with many "duplicate iptables rule detected"
warning messages due to try to add such forward rule each time when
trusted port is updated.
Now such rule is added only once for port.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/525607/

Change-Id: Ib816887f07f16b6ac865bb81d0f27f12d0b47dfb
Closes-Bug: #1754770

commit_message:
Support to get pool information for the runtime

Add an administrative operation for getting the pool information for the
runtime, so that the admin user can check the capacity of the runtime and
scale up or scale down the pool accordingly.

Change-Id: Iec4536396c1c31a9e545b09c5f46b46dc6d79ae6
Story: 2002969
Task: 22975

[{'created': '2018-06-22 11:14:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Disable IPv6 forwarding by default on HA routers

In case of HA routers IPv6 forwarding is not disabled by default and
then enabled only on master node.
Before this patch it was done in opposite way, so forwarding was
enabled by default and then disabled on backup nodes.
When forwarding was enabled/disabled for qg- port, MLDv2 packets are
sent and that might lead to temportary packets loss as packets to
FIP were sent to this backup node instead of master one.

Related-Bug: #1771841

(cherry picked from commit 3e9e2a5b4b2654864bb0e2a7d9b841eb03240147)

commit_message:
Disable IPv6 forwarding by default on HA routers

In case of HA routers IPv6 forwarding is not disabled by default and
then enabled only on master node.
Before this patch it was done in opposite way, so forwarding was
enabled by default and then disabled on backup nodes.
When forwarding was enabled/disabled for qg- port, MLDv2 packets are
sent and that might lead to temportary packets loss as packets to
FIP were sent to this backup node instead of master one.

Related-Bug: #1771841

Change-Id: Ia6b772e91c1f94612ca29d7082eca999372e60d6
(cherry picked from commit 3e9e2a5b4b2654864bb0e2a7d9b841eb03240147)

commit_message:
Update CI jobs for rescue mode

Sets rescue interface to 'agent' for testing rescue mode in most jobs.
The rescue mode is tested in test_baremetal_server_ops.

Also adds support for the new config option in ironic tempest plugin
default_rescue_interface.

Story: #1526449
Depends-On: I6b62724711ddbe17b59dad30283e544272d9c1f3
Change-Id: Ica26aa96978d22a681d69e7e1e4acd72182a4981

subject: Fix bug introduced by notify apache for heat-api
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-14 11:40:28.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/api.pp', 'manifests/api_cfn.pp'], 'message': "Fix bug introduced by notify apache for heat-api

The change [1] was wrong since it uses the wrong resource
name for the puppetlabs-apache Service defintion [2].

Instead of the revert this fixes it by changing it back to
the proper variable which has the value 'httpd'.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/581411/
[2] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-apache/blob/master/manifests/service.pp#L43

Change-Id: Ic943293d1ff9aa33c8095feb2b14d96a30a37914
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix bug introduced by notify apache for heat-api

The change [1] was wrong since it uses the wrong resource
name for the puppetlabs-apache Service defintion [2].

Instead of the revert this fixes it by changing it back to
the proper variable which has the value 'httpd'.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/581411/

version 3.0 or greater

commit_message:
Rename "ovs" occurances to "switch"

Any non-ovs specific reference in the code should be renamed to "switch"
so when we have modular switch backend, the only place where we will
have these names is in the ovs-specific driver.

Partial-Bug: #1781376
Change-Id: Ie220a03694ecee5c05e30f36880d8fb7a324b506

[{'created': '2018-02-13 20:10:49.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/services/loadbalancer/plugin.py'], 'message': "Log failed cert delete, and raise TLSContainerInvalid instead

It's possible that neutron can get a certificate, but not delete it. This
can cause the cert validation to raise a HTTP error instead of the
actual validation error.

This patch changes this by catching the cert_mgr error and logging it,

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Log failed cert delete, and raise TLSContainerInvalid instead

It's possible that neutron can get a certificate, but not delete it. This
can cause the cert validation to raise a HTTP error instead of the
actual validation error.

This patch changes this by catching the cert_mgr error and logging it,
allowing the original error to raise properly.

Change-Id: Icd8fd77a157481e3ce19ea71749bb6e0e3940967

commit_message:
Remove key "l7_policies" in pool dict

It will update pool when creating healthmonitor.
But we only need to update healthmonitor_id, and don't
care about others, so remove irrespective keys.

Change-Id: If10c2b46b9cd237496be21f4e7b2df644a76390a
Closes-Bug: #1733884

commit_message:
Add a compatible check before creating pool

When creating pool associated with incompatible protocol of listener,
pool will be created in the database and cannot delete it by command.
This patch add a compatible check before creating pool in database.

Change-Id: I8f749ad49e86c3d891c6965db86ae346a52f9634
Closes-Bug: #1556342

commit_message:
Provide support for solum dev mode in kolla

Add a possibility to mount sources as volumes to containers,
in "more than documentation" way. That will let us to use kolla
as a replacement for devstack.

Partially implements: blueprint mount-sources

Change-Id: If241033d8c94c13f980fc3cc322f198187d64a21

in "more than documentation" way. That will let us to use kolla

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-15 07:38:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Windows: fix exec calls

At some point, we've switched to an alternative process launcher
that uses named pipes to communicate with the child processes. This
implementation has some issues, truncating the process output in some
situations.

This change switches back to subprocess.Popen, which is a much easier
and convenient way to perform exec calls. We're also ensuring that the
os module is not patched (which would cause subprocess.Popen to fail
on Windows due to an eventlet limitation, the reason why the above
mentioned implementation was first introduced).

We're also ensuring that such calls do not block other greenthreads
by leveraging eventlet.tpool.

Side note: I had to store subprocess.Popen in a variable in order
to avoid having OpenStack bandit complaining, even though we're
explicitly passing "shell=False":
http://paste.openstack.org/raw/658319/

Closes-Bug: #1709931

Change-Id: Ib58e12030e69ea10862452c2f141a7a5f2527621
(cherry picked from commit 82d468ba7fd6dce91fec015d39126e71c1434fb1)

commit_message:
Windows: fix exec calls

At some point, we've switched to an alternative process launcher
that uses named pipes to communicate with the child processes. This
implementation has some issues, truncating the process output in some
situations.

This change switches back to subprocess.Popen, which is a much easier
and convenient way to perform exec calls. We're also ensuring that the
os module is not patched (which would cause subprocess.Popen to fail
on Windows due to an eventlet limitation, the reason why the above
mentioned implementation was first introduced).

We're also ensuring that such calls do not block other greenthreads
by leveraging eventlet.tpool.

Side note: I had to store subprocess.Popen in a variable in order
to avoid having OpenStack bandit complaining, even though we're
explicitly passing "shell=False":
http://paste.openstack.org/raw/658319/

Closes-Bug: #1709931

Change-Id: Ib58e12030e69ea10862452c2f141a7a5f2527621
(cherry picked from commit 82d468ba7fd6dce91fec015d39126e71c1434fb1)

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 07:28:45.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I75cd2533b50d8a095bdfcb7f8bc3c5777da705c3
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I75cd2533b50d8a095bdfcb7f8bc3c5777da705c3

commit_message:
Fixate pylint version, fullstack non-voting

The unfixated version causes pip to download pylint 2.0.0 which fails
with the error:
  pylint requires Python '>=3.4.*' but the running Python is 2.7.12

Fixating the version should solve this (and is common practice in most
openstack projects).

Additionally, the fullstack job has started to fail consistently.
Moving it to non-voting until it's investigated and fixed.

Change-Id: Ic8d7a26619919b26f8d3bd22679cb74fb9799004

commit_message:
Make sure we have our folders for uwsgi

Some package installs of the uwsgi packages aparently create
the folders while others do not.

So, lets create the folders!

Note: This is not ideal duplication wise, but we should refactor
this to be cleaner later.

Change-Id: I6a9f44d31c8b1def13586b5bb5d834bb08ccb3ed

commit_message:
Update standalone documentation

Since the merging of I6713469bfbd4fe9fc47d3cb2d3571fe10871f34e and
I0496f4dd2026ab6c705683126c8f50302a0861b9, the default role includes a
basic full cloud deployment and creates a clouds.yaml for the root user.
Update the documentation to include this information and how to leverage
the clouds.yaml.

Change-Id: I2c31e80000e55e70db26c24147e349d8ccd4d273
Related-Blueprint: all-in-one

[{'created': '2018-07-11 10:41:35.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/admin/index.rst', 'doc/source/user/index.rst', 'README.rst'], 'message': "Cleanup usage of 'simulator' and 'cloud-backed' in docs

Followup patch to rephrase 'cloud-backed' to indicate that
sushy-emulator is backed by libvirt or OpenStack cloud.

Change to use 'emulator' instead of 'simulator' across the docs.
As these emulators are used to substitute real Redfish BMC and
work to have same input/output as Redfish BMC, 'emulator' is the

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Cleanup usage of 'simulator' and 'cloud-backed' in docs

Followup patch to rephrase 'cloud-backed' to indicate that
sushy-emulator is backed by libvirt or OpenStack cloud.

Change to use 'emulator' instead of 'simulator' across the docs.
As these emulators are used to substitute real Redfish BMC and
work to have same input/output as Redfish BMC, 'emulator' is the
term to use.

Change-Id: Ic2ca3f4d6b485085d1fc0300f5e697ac0473982f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-05 11:24:23.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Fix ImportError for tox debug environment

When running `tox -e debug` there is an error:
ImportError: Start directory is not importable: './sushy-tools/tests'

This fixes it by passing test location to oslo_debug_helper.

Change-Id: I8c4833c30db572f300be5aacbb3bc0cf2d2f5023
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix ImportError for tox debug environment

When running `tox -e debug` there is an error:
ImportError: Start directory is not importable: './sushy-tools/tests'

This fixes it by passing test location to oslo_debug_helper.

Change-Id: I8c4833c30db572f300be5aacbb3bc0cf2d2f5023
